entry.def: If you add one thing to another, you put it in or on the other thing, to increase, complete, or improve it.

example.ex: Add the grated cheese to the sauce...
example.tran: 把磨碎的干酪加到调味汁里。

example.ex: Since 1908, chlorine has been added to drinking water...
example.tran: 自1908年以来氯就被添加进饮用水当中。

entry.def: If you add numbers or amounts together, you calculate their total.

example.ex: Banks add all the interest and other charges together...
example.tran: 银行合计所有利息和其他费用。

example.ex: Two and three added together are five.

entry.def: If one thing adds to another, it makes the other thing greater in degree or amount.

example.ex: This latest incident will add to the pressure on the government...
example.tran: 最近的这次事件将会给政府增加压力。

example.ex: Smiles, nods, and cheerful faces added to the general gaiety.
example.tran: 微笑、点头和喜洋洋的脸庞使喜庆的气氛变得更浓了。

entry.def: To add a particular quality to something means to cause it to have that quality.

example.ex: The generous amount of garlic adds flavour...
Pictures add interest to plain painted walls.
example.tran: 相片给素色的墙面增添了一抹情趣。

entry.def: If you add something when you are speaking, you say something more.

example.ex: 'You can tell that he is extremely embarrassed,' Mr Brigden added...
example.tran: “你能看出他尴尬极了，”布里格登先生补充道。

example.ex: The President agreed, adding that he hoped for a peaceful solution.
example.tran: 总统表示赞同并补充说他希望和平解决。

entry.def: You use added to this or added to that to introduce a fact that supports or widens what you are saying.

example.ex: More than 750 commercial airliners were involved in fatal accidents last year. Added to that were the 1,550 smaller aircraft.
example.tran: 去年750多家商业航空公司遭遇过人员死亡的事故。另外还有1,550架小型飞机也出过同样的事故。

means.word_mean: 1. make an addition (to); join or combine or unite with others; increase the quality, quantity, zise or scope of;

sentences.sentence: "We added two students to that dorm room"
"She added a personal note to her letter"
"Add some extra plates to the dinner table"
"Her presence lends a certain cachet to the company"
"The music added a lot to the play"
"She brings a special atmosphere to our meetings"
"This adds a light note to the program"

means.word_mean: 4. make an addition by combining numbers;

sentences.sentence: "Add all the people in this town to those of the neighboring town"
"This paper will add to her reputation"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Latin addere, from ad- 'to' + the base of dare 'put'
